abstract: Even if you can't find good fresh corn, frozen corn can be put to good use.
snippet: Even if you can't find good fresh corn, frozen corn can be put to good use.
lead_paragraph: Corn season is waning, so if you can't find decent ears of corn to make the Colombian chicken, short rib, and potato stew featured in "A Good Appetite," feel free to substitute frozen corn. I've seen it sold on the cob in large supermarkets, and that is ideal here. But if you can find only kernels, just use about a cup of them in place of the cobs, stirring them in during the last few minutes of cooking. Also something to note: The corn used in Colombia, I've read, has larger kernels and is less sweet than what we typically get. But the sweet corn tastes wonderful, authenticity aside.
